723792f-a.title: Manhattan: Vesey Street - West Broadway
723792f-a.text:
(1)
Vesey Street, north side, east from (No. 52) but not including West
Broadway, showing a portion of the Sixth Ave. Elevated Line on Church
Street and across it the 18-story Dnderwood Building at the N.E. corner
of Church Street. The row of buildings from No. 52 to 32, at the N.W.
corner of Church Street (where elevated structure is seen), is part of
the block which was rased to be replaced by a United States Post Office
in 1935.
July 26, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONNS.
(2)
A detail of the same, from a different angle, showing only Nos. 48
to 54. (These houses are seen in view 1, in the left foreground, in  their reverse order).
July 26, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

720207f-b.title: Manhattan: Greenwich Street - Vesey Street
720207f-b.text:
Greenwich Street, north from Vesey Street, showing
surface conditions under the Ninth Avenue Eleveted Lina
West Broadway is at the right, forming a convergence
with Greenwich Street at this point. The street car
tracks as shown are being removed by the W. P. A. at
this date. The old ''El'' structure overhead will be
demolished sometime in 1940-1.
June 2, 1937
W. P. A. photo
Five Boroughs Project
CREDIT LINE IMPERATTIVE
Greenwich Street, north from Vesey Street.
Vperr  99\& A2R6ucroas  May 4, 1941

723795f-a.text:
(1)
72 to 80 Vesey Street, at, adjoining and west of the N.W. corner of
Greenwich Street. The 3-story corner house (No. 72) also bears Nos.
206-210 Greenwich Street. Nos. 74 and 76-78 are 2 and 3-story frame
houses respectively.
May 5, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
A closer view of the fruit market at the corner.
July 26, 1930.

723795f-a.folder: Vesey Street & Greenwich Street, Manhattan, NY

723785f-a.title: Manhattan: Vesey Street - Greenwich Street
723785f-a.text:
Vesey Street, north side, at Greenwich Street and West
Broadway. At the left are two frame buildings to the west of
Greenwich Street. These are No's. 76-8 and 74 Vesey Street.
The Ninth Avenue ''g1' is on Greenwich Street. East of same
is a triangular structure that seperates this thoroughfare
fro West Broadway. The entire block beyond is being cleared
in View 2. Upon this site rose the new downtown Federal offico
building and Post Office. In the background is the distinctive
Woolworth Building. View 2 includes the later Transportation
Building.
September, 1914
Oeorge L. Balgue
MAY BE REPRODUCED
April 3, 1934
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

720208f-a.title: Manhattan: Greenwich Street - West Broadway
720208f-a.text:
The intersection of Greenwich Street, and West Broadway, at Vesey
Street. Shown is Greenwich Street, (Ninth Ave., Elevated) east side,
north from Vesey, to, but not including Barclay Streets.
May S, 1927.
P. L. Snerr.

The same location, showing Christmas trees piled outside of these
retail gardener shops for sale to Jersey commuters.
December 11, 1937.
L. Sperr.  NO REPRODUCTIONS.

720208f-b.title: Manhattan: Greenwich Street - West Broadway
720208f-b.text:
The intersection of Greenwich Street, and West Broadway, at Vesey
Street. Shown is Greenwich Street, (Ninth Ave., Elevated) east side,
north from Vesey, to, but not including Barclay Streets.
May S, 1927.
P. L. Snerr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
The same location, showing Christmas trees piled outside of these
retail gardener shops for sale to Jersey commuters.

732378f-a.title: Occupations - Peddlers - Flowers.
732378f-a.text:
Peddlers, Flowers: Horticultural materials for Mothers Day sale.
A set of 2 views; No. 1 being northward on the west side of Greenwich
Street from Dey Street; No. 2, is at Vesey and Greenwich Streets.
May 11, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
732378f-a.folder: Greenwich Street and Vesey Street, Manhattan, N.Y.

3-5 West Broadway, east sideg between Vesey and Barclay Streets.

March 23, 1928.
